A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I'm in my 30's and have grown up in the Star Wars universe\, unfortunately this movie typifies what's wrong with the franchise now .  Basically Disney is killing off the old characters to make way for more easily marketable diverse/shallow characters to MAKE MORE MONEY.  The most ironic part of the movie is Disney vilifying the "military industrial complex" and "the globalists" aka the casino planet scene: Disney YOU are the globalists and money makers that profiteer off of the working classes of the world.   I don't want to rant\, but the Luke Skywalker in this movie\, in my mind\, is in no way shape or form associated with the Luke that I have grown to love over the past 30 years.

I'll go to the theater next December to be disappointed again and again until I learn my lesson.  Its just so hard to say goodbye to an old love..     

Positives cool space battles and planet environments graphics\, The books\, video games\, and comics are still good.
